oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BARBADOS NATIONAL COASTAL RISK INFORMATION AND PLANNING PLATFORM A SOFTWARE SYSTEM FOR HAZARDS, VULNERABILITY & RISK
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Taylor, David
Williamson, Derek
Kaur, Harprit
Macintosh, Kevin
Brewster, Leo
Roach, Ramon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Barbados National Coastal Risk Information and Planning Platform (NCRIPP) is a study nearing completion to quantify coastal risk and develop a software system to serve this information country-wide. The NCRIPP follows extensive coastal baseline studies and includes assessment of eight hazards, vulnerability assessment and finally a risk assessment. The software platform is a cloud-based system that includes a large catalogue of assets, hazard overlays, and the ability to calculate damages , and mitigation alternatives.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36 (2018): Proceedings of 36th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Baltimore, Maryland, 2018; risk.55
